column4: is there any real difference from using iwconfig wlan0 up, or, ifup wlan0 ?
yes. use ifup.
any particular reason ?
ifup will do things like actually configure the wireless connection via the settings in /etc/network/interfaces
another question: how come when i do ifdown wlan0 when i open System/Administration/Netowkr it still shows as activated (checkbox checked) ?
are you using Network Manager?
yes
i would rather use just command-line
if you edit the connection in the network admin, do you have "Roaming Mode" enabled?
no, i manually add the information
so when you do ifconfig down, you're breaking Debian Networking's internal state i think
but i see a descrepency , iwconfig shows differnt. can i use just ifconfig/ifup soley and remove netowrk manager completely ?
you may remove n-m completely but you should configure your devices in /etc/network/interfaces and use ifup / ifdown instead of ifconfig

ifconfig only deals with one particular layer of the networking stuff i think
in particular the link layer
for ethernet, you need to e.g. run dhclient in order to get an IP address automatically
i have run into NetManager messing with my connection before, and i thought it was because i was doing command-line. i dont like NetManager anyhow, so it is toast
whereas ifup/ifdown will do all that automatically
